page.title: 07School and Club,Church Lench
page.content: The school was built in 1864.It is now a first school and has 63 pupils aged from 5 to 10 years ,with 3 teachers.Some of the children arrive by bus.Lunches and milk are no longer provided,so the children bring packed lunches.There is a good sized games field and a keen football team. As the Pub was closed by the Lord of the Manor,a hut with a fireplace in the middle was used as a meeting place until 1947,when the local people asked for a club to be built.The hut was replaced by a building on church land. The club is run by a Steward .The total membership is 450 and the annual subscription is 2.This year a skittle alley has been added. Pool,darts, cribbage,dominoes and bingo are also played.Having a bar weddings and parties are catered for. The cricket club is based here.
